content.description:
Laavutate is a three move wonder, but it's a fun one. Sit start on the north overhanging side of the boulder next to the finger crack/seam and large, sloping ledge. That's pretty much your line. Move up the seam and ledge, throw a big heel, and reach for the lip to top out.

Walk off the V0 slab right, or jump down onto your pad.
content.protection: 1 pad, no spotter is needed for this guy.
content.location: On the North side of the boulder, the features are obvious.

content.description: On the southwest side of the boulder, you'll find a low angle slab starting about stomach height with some good sidepulls, which you'll use and then cruise to the top. Stand starting this route makes it go at about V0. Sit starting is a little trickier and probably bumps it up to a V1 or V2. This is the way you'll downclimb the other routes on the boulder. It is good for a warm-up, but once you're ready, I'd "head around back" as the name implies.
content.location: It ascends the Southwest side of the boulder, or top out somewhere else, and it's the obvious downclimb.

pathTokens: Sleeping Rock aka Sheep's Nose Bouldering
